  EV_OK = 0, EV_ERR_NOT_PORT = -0x002, EV_ERR_NOT_ADDR = -0x003, EV_ERR_SOCKET = -0x100,

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(*) ev_poll_cb_wakeup(int fd, void *arg)

Callback prototype for file descriptor event

typedef void(*) ev_signal_run(int signal, void *arg)

Callback prototype for signal event

typedef void(*) ev_timeout_run(struct timeval *tv, struct ev_timeout_node *self, void *)

Callback prototype for timeout events

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ev_errors

errors codes

Enumerator:
EV_OK  no errors
EV_ERR_NOT_PORT  ev_socket_bind: port is not a number
EV_ERR_NOT_ADDR  address unavalaible
EV_ERR_SOCKET  error with syscall socket
EV_ERR_FCNTL  error with syscall fcntl
EV_ERR_SETSOCKO  error with syscall setsockopt
EV_ERR_BIND  error with syscall bind
EV_ERR_LISTEN  error with syscall listen
EV_ERR_ACCEPT  error with syscall accept
EV_ERR_CALLOC  error with syscall calloc
EV_ERR_SELECT  error with syscall select
EV_ERR_SIGACTIO  error with syscall sigaction
EV_ERR_MALLOC  error with syscall sigaction

enum ev_mode

event mode

Enumerator:
EV_POLL_READ  The file descriptor operation is about read
EV_POLL_WRITE  The file descriptor operation is about write

enum ev_synch

define signal event mode

Enumerator:
EV_SIGNAL_SYNCH  define the event signal synchronous
EV_SIGNAL_ASYNCH  define the event signal asynchronous

mode is for choosing event register

ev_mode  mode 
) [inline, static]

check if file descriptor is set

Parameters:
fd is the watched filedescriptor
mode is for choosing event register
Returns:
Return true if the file descriptor is set, else return false

static ev_errors ev_poll_init ( int  maxfd,
struct ev_timeout_basic_node *  tmoutbase 
) [inline, static]

init events system

Parameters:
maxfd contain the number of file descriptor used for the poller
tmoutbase contain the base of the timeouts tree
Returns:
On success, return 0, else return error code < 0. The error can be EV_ERR_CALLOC.

static ev_errors ev_poll_poll ( void   )  [inline, static]

run poller

Returns:
On success, return 0, else return error code < 0. The error can be EV_ERR_SELECT.

ev_errors ev_signal_add ( int  signal,
ev_synch  sync,
ev_signal_run  func,
void *  arg 
)

add signal

Parameters:
signal is signal number (see /usr/include/bits/signum.h on common linux systems)
sync is the synchronous mode. with EV_SIGNAL_SYNCH the callback is called when the signal is received. With the EV_SIGNAL_ASYNCH, the callback wait for a ev_signal_check_active functioncall.
func is signal function pointer
arg is easy argument gived to signal function
Returns:
EV_OK if ok, else < 0 if an error is occured. The error can be EV_ERR_SIGACTIO

void ev_signal_check_active ( void   ) 

check for active signal and call callbacks

static void ev_signal_hide ( int  signal  )  [inline, static]

hide signal: the signal is ignored. If run queue contain previous signals theses are deleted

Parameters:
signal is signal number (see /usr/include/bits/signum.h on common linux systems)

static void ev_signal_show ( int  signal  )  [inline, static]

show signal: the signal is now consider

Parameters:
signal is signal number (see /usr/include/bits/signum.h on common linux systems)

ev_errors ev_socket_accept ( int  listen_socket,
struct sockaddr_storage *  addr 
)

accept connection

Parameters:
listen_socket is a socket that has been created with ev_socket_bind and is listening for connections. (see man accept)
addr A pointer to the preallocated struct. This struct is filled with a client address.
Returns:
if ok, return new file desciptor. else return <0. the errors can be EV_ERR_ACCEPT, EV_ERR_FCNTL or EV_ERR_SETSOCKO.

ev_errors ev_socket_bind ( char *  socket_name,
int  backlog 
)

create and bind a socket

Parameters:
socket_name like "<ipv4>:<port>" "<ipv6>:<port>" or "socket_unix_file"
backlog The backlog parameter defines the maximum length the queue of pending connections may grow to. (see man listen)
Returns:
if ok, return the file descriptor, else return < 0. the errors can be: EV_ERR_NOT_PORT, EV_ERR_NOT_ADDR, EV_ERR_SOCKET, EV_ERR_FCNTL, EV_ERR_SETSOCKO, EV_ERR_BIND or EV_ERR_LISTEN.

static ev_errors ev_timeout_add ( struct ev_timeout_basic_node *  base,
struct timeval *  tv,
ev_timeout_run  func,
void *  arg,
struct ev_timeout_node **  node 
) [inline, static]

insert timeout

Parameters:
base preallocated base node
tv the hour of event must be wake up
func the timeout callback called
arg a easy argument gived to timeout function
node if node != NULL, a pointer to the new timeout node is set;
Returns:
EV_OK if ok, < 0 if an error is occured. the error code can be EV_ERR_MALLOC
